title: Increase state manager reachability timeout.
body:
The state manager currently has a 2 second timeout and then it will try to tunnel. We ran into some issues with containers in kubernetes failing and then the tunnel failed to because ssh was not installed on the container. This is the first step in trying to make the state manager more resilient. This change increases the timeout to 5 seconds.

Error from container:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "heron/executor/src/python/heron_executor.py", line 912, in start_state_manager_watches
  File "heron/statemgrs/src/python/zkstatemanager.py", line 65, in start
    localhostports = self.establish_ssh_tunnel()
  File "heron/statemgrs/src/python/statemanager.py", line 110, in establish_ssh_tunnel
    ('ssh', self.tunnelhost, '-NL127.0.0.1:%d:%s:%d' % (localport, host, port))))
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/subprocess.py", line 710, in __init__
    errread, errwrite)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/subprocess.py", line 1327, in _execute_child
    raise child_exception
OSError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory

title: Be explicit about subprocess pipe's EOF.
body:
We should not check if a subprocess has terminated to determine if we have read all bytes from subprocess's pipe. This PR makes EOF explicit when reading from pipe.

Also use list and join instead of concatenation to collect output faster.

repo.name: incubator-heron
repo.description: Apache Heron (Incubating) is a realtime, distributed, fault-tolerant stream processing engine from Twitter

title: Changing TimeTriggerPolicy to use tick tuples as a timer
body:
TimeTriggerPolicy used an additional thread to run periodic tasks.  Tuple acking was conducted as part of these periodic tasks.  However, OutgoingTupleCollection isn't thread safe thus causing NPEs.  Thus I removed the separate thread to run periodic tasks and instead used tick tuples to trigger the tasks. 

I also changed Tick Tuple to frequency to milliseconds since windowing needs to support windows in milliseconds.  I left a backwards compatible api for seconds:

public static void setTickTupleFrequency(Map<String, Object> conf, int seconds) 

Which will translate to milliseconds

I also add logic in bolt instance to persist config changes done in topology logic when updates to the physical plan occurs

title: clean heron java instance for stateful processing
body:
During the testing of stateful processing with java HeronInstance, I found several problems:
1. Slave thread is destroyed during restore
2. logic of handling if the instance's slave looper should be started is confusing
3. IInstance interface is not very clean and well organized
4. stmgr accidently cleans instance info 

This PR is fixing the above mentioned issues and with some code refactoring. Tested locally now the stateful processing for java instance is working normally and even with failure cases like instance dying, stmgr dying, tmaster dying.

title: clean python state manager
body:
Our internal building is reporting the unit test for `statemanagerfactory.py` is failing. It turns out that the unit test is trying to connect to a local zk server. Obviously there's no local zk, so the test fails.

This PR is separating the creation of state managers and the actual connection to zk. With this change, it is cleaner and also easier to test. 

Verified with localzk cluster, topology is started correctly.

title: Add heron cli config setting for service_url.
body:
Add a way to save cli specific configuration. Only service_url is supported right now.

Examples:
heron config [cluster] list - displays cli property values for a cluster

heron config [cluster] set <prop> <value>- sets a property value for a cluster

heron config [cluster] unset <prop> - clears a cli config property for a cluster

title: fix python state manager
body:
Recent internal zookeeper server unstable issue caused our topologies fail to be started. The log shows that heron executor  continues execution even after an exception is logged.

```
[2017-09-16 00:21:40 +0000] [ERROR]: Exception while connecting to state_manager.
[2017-09-16 00:21:40 +0000] [INFO]: Adding data watch for path: ${SOME_PATH}
[2017-09-16 00:21:40 +0000] [INFO]: Registered state watch for packing plan changes with state manager <heron.statemgrs.src.python.zkstatemanager.ZkStateManager object at ${SOME_ADDR}>.
[2017-09-16 00:43:27 +0000] [INFO]: signal_handler invoked with signal 15
```

With further investigation, we found that methods in `statemanagerfactory` only logs an exception and then swallows it. Ideally, the state manager should either fail fast or propagate exceptions to upper layer.

This PR is to fix the problem. `statemanagerfactory` propagate exception after logging it and `heron_executor` exit immediately if it catches any exception from state manager.

I tested the logic locally by throwing an exception on purpose. And the heron-executor exits once caught the exception

title: Seperate Stmgr and Instance Serving in Stmgr
body:
In the current stmgr, all incoming traffic(from peer stmgr and local instances) are multiplexed in the same server. This makes the class complex. Secondly when connection setup/disconnect happen it is not completely clear whether it was stmgr or an instance related. Plus it doesn't allow us to do differentiated handling between the two traffic. One is a inter-container traffic and the other is a intra-container traffic. We could perhaps encrypt the inter-container traffic, while intra-container can be sent via shared memory.
This pr seperates out this functionality. StMgrServer handles traffic from other stmgrs while InstanceServer handles traffic from local containers.

title: fix bugs in stmgr unit test
body:
Three problems found for the current stmgr and its unit test:
1. `register_request_` needs to be cleared before setting it again. Otherwise it will cause duplicate instances' info.
2. Increase the packet size limit option for dummy stmgr, spout and bolt. This is to match with the real stmgr started during the unit test.
3. use `if` clause instead of the `CHECK_EQ` on `reconnect_timer_id` to create timer

title: Fix Python docs generation
body: This PR fixes an issue with documentation generation that was created when the library was renamed from `heron` back to `heronpy`. It also fixes two other issues that came to my attention: running `make pages` needs to happen *after* all API doc generation or else API docs won't end up in the `public` folder, which is necessary for GitHub Pages; and appending the `|| true` statement to the end of the Javadoc generation command ensures that Javadoc errors won't prevent us from being able to generate the site.

title: Use bufferevent to do Network I/O
body:
libevent has buffer event library that takes care of actually reading/writing from socket descriptors. Managing write readiness, reading/writing using vectors efficiently, zero copy buffer management are all done internally by bufferevent.
In this pr, we start using bufferevent to do the io rather than doing native i/o. This change greatly simplifies the networking code. There should be no performance penalty.
In addition to simplification of the code, this change has several benefits
1. bufferevents allow sophisticated rate limiting techniques(like leaky buckets) to control the rate of io.
2. bufferevents have priority groups which would in the future allow us to do differentiated io for spouts/bolts
3. adding ssl support for end to end encryption becomes trivial since bufferevents supports it natively.
4. Makes running stmgr on non posix api machines straightforward(windows)
